results.title: Jerry Maguire
results.creator_credit: Cameron Crowe, James L. Brooks and Gracie Films
results.brief_description: Jerry Maguire set Hollywood abuzz in 1996 because it seemed to represent a return to films about people. Jerry Maguire (Tom Cruise) is a sports agent who starts to re-evaluate his success driven life. During a conference Jerry writes out a mission statement under a storm of inspiration, distributing it to everyone. When he gets back to work he discovers he’s been sacked and is left with only one client, Rod Tidwell (Cuba Gooding Jr) and one loyal employee, Dorothy Boyd (Renee Zellweger). Now Jerry has to struggle for his survival both as a sports agent and in his personal life as he is drawn into the lives of Dorothy and her son Ray (Jonathan Lipnicki). Cameron Crowe wrote and directed this heart warming romantic comedy which has lots to say about the commerce driven world we live in. Cuba Gooding Jr received and Oscar for Best Supporting Actor (1997) and Tom Cruise received a Golden Globe Award (1997) for Best Actor in a Comedy/Musical.

results.title: Je
results.creator_credit: Leonard Forest, ONF | NFB and Louis Portugais

Sound arrangement: Maurice Blackburn.

results.title: Jazz
results.creator_credit: Ken Burns, BBC, WETA-TV and Florentine Films
results.brief_description: JAZZ is a comprehensive 4 volume series directed by Ken Burns that presents a detailed history of the musical form from its beginnings in the early 19th Century to its development up to the present day. Researched and produced over a six year period it is a thorough and broad study of the history of Jazz and its musicians and includes musicians’ biographies, renowned and rare recordings, footage of live performances, interviews with artists, historians, writers and critics and rare film clips and still photographs that form an extraordinary mix of interpretations of and insight into the characters, origins, development, techniques and reshaping of the diverse musical form that is Jazz.

results.title: Japanese Story
results.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, Alison Tilson, Sue Brooks, Sue Maslin, Film Victoria, ScreenWest, Showtime Australia, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Gecko Films
results.brief_description:
Australian geologist Sandy (Toni Collette) lands the unwanted task of showing a Japanese businessman Hiromitsu (Gotaro Tsunashima) around the mines and deserts of the Pilbara, hoping to sell his company the geology software she has been co-developing. Hiromitsu mistakes her for his driver and demands they go off-road, unaware of the dangers. The two journey further into the West Australian desert, gradually leaving what they know about each other and themselves behind.

Winner of 21 Australian film awards including 8 AFI Awards. Cast also includes Matthew Dyktynski, Lynette Curran, Yumiko Tanaka, John Howard.

results.title: Jane Austen in Manhattan
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant, Polytel Films and Merchant Ivory Productions
results.brief_description: Anne Baxter, in one of her greatest performances, plays the elegant Lilianna, an actress and drama coach, struggling to produce a newly discovered Jane Austen play. However, the manuscript is in the hands of Pierre (Robert Powell), an ex-student of Lilianna’s, who has broken away from traditional theatre values into bizzare experimental techniques and a raging tug-of-war ensues between the traditional and experimental. Co-starring Michael Wager, Tim Choate, Sean Young, John Guerrasio, Katrina Hodiak, Kurt Johnson, Philip Lenkowsky, Nancy New and Charles McCaughan. Written by Ruth Prawer Jhabvala and based upon Sir Charles Grandison or “The Happy Man”.

results.title: Jackson Pollock
results.creator_credit: Kim Evans, RM Arts and South Bank Show
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
This documentary shows Jackson Pollack, the most famous twentieth century American painter, as the controversial star of the New York art scene in the forties and fifties, who founded the movement ‘Abstract Expressionism’. It is an interesting look at Pollock’s life and death through various interviews with friends, from the cowboy myth, to the drunken, fast driving masculine artist. It is a documentary as revealing and engaging as Pollock’s work itself. There is footage of the artist at work finding his own technique of dripping and splashing fluid paint onto unstretched canvas layed out on the floor. It traces his history as an artist showing his early influences of native American sandpainting to his rise as an abstract expressionist. Edited and presented by Melvyn Bragg.

results.title: It's a mad mad mad mad world
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kramer and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A mammoth cast includes Spencer Tracy, Milton Berle, Sid Caeser, Buddy Hackett, Ethel Merman, Mickey Rooney, Dick Shawn, Phil Silvers, Terry Thomas, Jonathan Winters, Edie Adams, Dorothy Provine, Peter Falk and Jimmy Durante. Kramer’s film recalls the zany slapstick era of silent films. Durante is a dying millionaire who gives a secret clue to the location of his buried fortune. Everyone is out to beat everyone else to the loot and nothing is done in moderation. Every obstacle is put in the path of the treasure-seekers and dealt with in unexpected or illogical ways. With this bevy of comic actors, no single performance shines and the laughs abound.

results.title: Islam: empire of faith
results.creator_credit: Robert H Gardner, Public Broadcasting Service (U.S.), Devillier Donegan Enterprises and Gardner Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Empires”.
This three part history of Islam is narrated by Ben Kingsley. In episode 1, “The Messenger”, we are introduced to pre-monotheistic Arab society. In a desert world consisting of warring nomadic tribes, differences were only put aside when the tribes congregated in the holy city of Mecca to worship their individual gods and totems. From this centre of trade and religion, the Prophet Muhammad first began to receive visions from the one God. Though initially exiled by his opponents, Muhammad finds refuge in the oasis of Medina, and there he builds up a strong and loyal following united, for the first time, not by blood but by faith. Having conquered the Meccan forces sent to vanquish him and his followers, Muhammad triumphantly returned to Mecca, smashed the idols and proclaimed his divine message. In episode 2, “The Awakening”, the recording of the Prophet’s vision in the Koran sees the spread of Islam throughout the Arabian peninsula, and then to Persia, India, North African and Southern Europe and the Balkans. The religion leads to a democratisation of society and a flourishing of art, architecture, philosophy and science as the Muslim scholars integrate the thoughts of the ancient Greeks with the philosophy arising from Islam. The Islamic Empire is, however, threatened by the Crusades initiated by the fundamentalist European Christians, and then further dispersed by the massacres and invasions of the Mongol Empire. In episode 3, “The Ottomans”, we see how the Islamic world has been transformed by the Mongol invasion and the Mongols in turn have been transformed by their conversion to Islam. Nomadic tribes from Anatolia, enlisted to combat the Mongols, unite and form the beginning of the Ottoman Empire. One of the world’s largest empires, the Ottomans move into Christian Europe and take as their seat the Byzantine city of Constantinople. From the renamed city, Istanbul, the Ottomans create a flourishing art and culture. The episode concentrates on the career of Suleyman the Magnificent, the most talented, important and fierce of the Ottoman Sultans.

Having conquered the Meccan forces sent to vanquish him and his followers, Muhammad triumphantly returned to Mecca, smashed the idols and proclaimed his divine message. In episode 2, “The Awakening”, the recording of the Prophet’s vision in the Koran sees the spread of Islam throughout the Arabian peninsula, and then to Persia, India, North African and Southern Europe and the Balkans. The religion leads to a democratisation of society and a flourishing of art, architecture, philosophy and science as the Muslim scholars integrate the thoughts of the ancient Greeks with the philosophy arising from Islam. The Islamic Empire is, however, threatened by the Crusades initiated by the fundamentalist European Christians, and then further dispersed by the massacres and invasions of the Mongol Empire. In episode 3, “The Ottomans”, we see how the Islamic world has been transformed by the Mongol invasion and the Mongols in turn have been transformed by their conversion to Islam. Nomadic tribes from Anatolia, enlisted to combat the Mongols, unite and form the beginning of the Ottoman Empire. One of the world’s largest empires, the Ottomans move into Christian Europe and take as their seat the Byzantine city of Constantinople. From the renamed city, Istanbul, the Ottomans create a flourishing art and culture. The episode concentrates on the career of Suleyman the Magnificent, the most talented, important and fierce of the Ottoman Sultans.
